info.description: Complete API collection for Continuum Backend - Freelancer Productivity Platform

request.description: Check if the API is running
Create a new user account. Roles: frontend, backend, designer, project_manager, client, admin
Authenticate user and receive access/refresh tokens

exec: // Save new tokens on successful refresh

request.description: Exchange refresh token for new access token. Send refresh_token as query parameter.
Request password reset token (check server logs for token)
Reset password using token from email
Logout user by invalidating refresh token. Idempotent - can be called multiple times safely.

query.description: Token from registration email (check server logs)

request.description: Verify user email address

Get current authenticated user profile. Returns full user object including id, email, first_name, last_name, role, hourly_rate, display_name, is_verified, and created_at. Requires Bearer token authentication.
Update current user profile. All fields are optional: first_name, last_name, hourly_rate, display_name
Change current user's password. Requires current password verification. User remains logged in after password change.
Get admin dashboard (requires ADMIN or PROJECTMANAGER role)

item.name: Clients

request.description: Create a new client (admin only)
List all clients (admin only)
Get client details by ID
Update client (admin only)
Delete client (admin only)

item.description: Client management endpoints (admin only - requires ADMIN or PROJECTMANAGER role)

request.description: Create a new project (admin only - requires ADMIN or PROJECTMANAGER role, requires client_id)
List all projects (filterable by client_id, status)
Get project details with tasks, members, and hours
Update project (admin or project member)
Delete project (admin only)
Get all members of a project
Add a member to a project (admin only - requires ADMIN or PROJECTMANAGER role)
Remove a member from a project (admin only - requires ADMIN or PROJECTMANAGER role)
Get project statistics (total hours, task counts, member activity) - NOT IMPLEMENTED YET
Get project health indicators (overdue tasks, inactive members) - NOT IMPLEMENTED YET

request.description: Create a new task (requires project_id)
List tasks (filterable by project_id, status, assigned_to)
Get task details with logged hours and assignee
Update task (status, assignee, description)
Delete task (admin only - requires ADMIN or PROJECTMANAGER role)
Assign or unassign task. Send user_id in body (or null to unassign). Requires project membership.
Update task status (todo, in_progress, done)

query.description: Maximum number of activities to return (1-1000)

request.description: Get the complete activity timeline for a task. Returns all task-related activities in chronological order (oldest first): task creation, status changes, assignment changes, attachments, logged hours, and linked git commits. Requires project membership (or admin). This endpoint serves as the source of truth for task history, backbone for client reports, and primary input for AI summaries and insights.

item.name: Logged Hours

request.description: Log hours for a task or project. Requires project_id (task_id is optional). Users can only log hours to tasks they are assigned to OR projects they are members of.
List logged hours (filterable by user, task, project, date range)
Get logged hour details
Update logged hour (owner only)
Delete logged hour (owner or admin)
Get all logged hours for a specific task. Returns total hours and optional breakdown per user (if admin or task assignee).
Get all logged hours for a specific project. Returns total hours and breakdown per user. Users can view hours for projects they are members of.

item.description: Logged hours / work sessions endpoints - Implemented and ready to test

item.name: Git Contributions

request.description: Create a new git contribution. Requires: user_id, project_id, commit_hash, provider. Optional: task_id, branch, commit_message, commit_url. User must be a member of the project. Same commit hash cannot be linked twice to the same project.

List git contributions with optional filters. Filters are combinable: user_id, project_id, provider. Admins can view all contributions. Regular users can only view contributions from projects they are members of.
Get a git contribution by ID. User must be a member of the project (or admin).
Update a git contribution. Only the contributor or admin can update. If updating task_id, task must belong to the contribution's project.

query.description: Task ID to link (omit or set to null to unlink)

request.description: Link a contribution to a task. Only the contributor or admin can link commits. Task must belong to the contribution's project. Omit task_id or set to null to unlink.

item.description: Git contributions endpoints - Track commits linked to projects and tasks

item.name: Task Attachments

request.description: Upload a file attachment to a task. Requires project membership (or admin). File size limit: 10MB. Supports all file types (configurable via ALLOWED_MIME_TYPES). Returns attachment metadata including uploader info.
List all attachments for a task. Requires project membership (or admin). Returns list with attachment metadata including uploader info, file size, MIME type, and timestamps.
Download an attachment file. Requires project membership (or admin). Returns the file with appropriate Content-Type and Content-Disposition headers.
Delete an attachment. Only the uploader or admin can delete. Removes both the database record and the file from storage.

item.description: Task attachment endpoints - Upload, view, download, and manage file attachments on tasks

item.name: Invoices

request.description: Generate an invoice from logged hours for a project. Requires project membership or admin. Billing period must contain logged hours. All users involved must have hourly rates set. Invoice items snapshot hours and rates at generation time. PDF is generated and stored automatically.

query.description: Maximum number of records to return (1-1000)

request.description: List invoices. Users can only see invoices for projects they're members of. Admins can see all invoices. Can filter by project_id.
Get invoice details with all line items. User must be a project member or admin. Returns full invoice with all line items including user, task, hours, rates, and totals.
Update invoice status (admin only). Valid statuses: draft, sent, paid, overdue, cancelled. Totals are immutable and cannot be changed.
Download invoice PDF. User must be a project member or admin. Generates PDF if it doesn't exist. Returns PDF file for download with filename invoice_{invoice_number}.pdf

item.description: Invoice endpoints - Generate invoices from logged hours, manage invoice status, and download PDFs
